what: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: ReVAMP provides R interface Vamp audio analysis plugin system developed Queen Mary University London’s Centre Digital Music. enables R users load run Vamp plugins tasks like tempo detection, onset detection, spectral analysis, feature extraction.

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Comprehensive Plugin Support: Access 100+ Vamp plugins audio analysis Automatic Adaptation: Handles channel mixing, domain conversion, buffering automatically Three Output Sample Types: OneSamplePerStep, FixedSampleRate, VariableSampleRate Data Frame Output: Results returned R data frames easy analysis visualization Optional File Export: Optionally write results CSV files

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
code: library(ReVAMP) library(tuneR)  # Load audio file audio <- readWave("myaudio.wav")  # Run amplitude follower and get results as data frame result <- runPlugin(   myname = "analysis",   soname = "vamp-example-plugins",   id = "amplitudefollower",   output = "amplitude",   outputNo = 0,   wave = audio,   outfilename = "",  # Empty string = no file output   useFrames = FALSE  # Use timestamps in seconds )  # Examine results str(result) #> 'data.frame':    1292 obs. of  4 variables: #>  $ timestamp: num  0.000 0.023 0.046 0.070 0.093 ... #>  $ duration : num  NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA NA ... #>  $ value    : num  22866 22896 22735 22531 22380 ... #>  $ label    : chr  "" "" "" "" ...  # Plot amplitude over time plot(result$timestamp, result$value, type = "l",      xlab = "Time (s)", ylab = "Amplitude",      main = "Audio Amplitude")

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Detect note onsets audio:
code: onsets <- runPlugin(   myname = "analysis",   soname = "vamp-aubio-plugins",   id = "aubioonset",   output = "onsets",   outputNo = 0,   wave = audio,   outfilename = "",   useFrames = FALSE )  # View onset times print(onsets$timestamp)  # Plot onsets on waveform plot(audio) abline(v = onsets$timestamp * audio@samp.rate, col = "red", lty = 2)

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Estimate tempo (BPM):
code: tempo <- runPlugin(   myname = "analysis",   soname = "vamp-aubio-plugins",   id = "aubiotempo",   output = "tempo",   outputNo = 0,   wave = audio,   outfilename = "",   useFrames = FALSE )  cat("Estimated tempo:", mean(tempo$value), "BPM\n")

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins

code: centroid <- runPlugin(   myname = "analysis",   soname = "vamp-example-plugins",   id = "spectralcentroid",   output = "logcentroid",   outputNo = 0,   wave = audio,   outfilename = "",   useFrames = FALSE )  plot(centroid$timestamp, centroid$value, type = "l",      xlab = "Time (s)", ylab = "Log Centroid",      main = "Spectral Centroid Over Time")

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: ReVAMP consists three layers: Vamp Plugin SDK (inst/vamp/): C++ libraries defining Vamp plugin interface Vamp Host SDK (src/Plugin*.cpp): C++ host implementation loads manages plugins R Interface (src/R_host.cpp): Rcpp bindings exposing functionality R Key features: - PluginLoader: Discovers loads Vamp plugins system directories - Plugin Adapters: Automatically handle channel mixing, domain conversion (time/frequency), buffering - DataFrame Output: Collects features memory returns structured data R

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Input: tuneR::Wave S4 objects R Conversion: Extracted float buffers C++ Processing: Fed block--block Vamp plugins automatic adaptation Output: Collected memory returned DataFrame R Optional File: Can also write CSV file outfilename provided

what: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: Executes Vamp audio analysis plugin Wave object returns outputs produced plugin. main function performing audio feature extraction analysis.

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
code: runPlugin(key, wave, params = NULL, useFrames = FALSE)

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: key Character string specifying plugin "library:plugin" format (e.g., "vamp-example-plugins:amplitudefollower", "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset"). Use vampPlugins see available plugins keys. wave Wave object tuneR package containing audio data analyze. Can mono stereo. params Optional named list parameter values configure plugin. Parameter names must match parameter identifiers vampPluginParams. Values coerced numeric. NULL (default), plugin default parameter values used. useFrames Logical indicating whether use frame numbers (TRUE) timestamps (FALSE) output. Default FALSE.

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: named list data frames, one output produced plugin. names correspond output identifiers (e.g., "amplitude", "onsets"). data frame contains columns timestamp (frame), duration, values, labels (applicable). plugin one output, list one element.

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: Many Vamp plugins produce multiple outputs. example, onset detector might output "onsets" (discrete event times) "detection_function" (continuous measure). function returns outputs, allowing access whichever ones need. plugin automatically adapt audio characteristics: Channel mixing/augmentation plugin requirements differ input Time/frequency domain conversion needed Buffering handle different block sizes output data frame typically includes: timestamp: Time frame number feature duration: Duration feature (applicable, otherwise NA) value/value1/value2/...: Feature values (number columns varies) label: Text label feature (applicable, otherwise empty) function supports three Vamp output sample types: OneSamplePerStep: Regular intervals based step size FixedSampleRate: Output fixed rate (may differ input) VariableSampleRate: Sparse output irregular intervals

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(tuneR)  # Load audio file audio <- readWave("myaudio.wav")  # Run amplitude follower plugin - returns list with one output result <- runPlugin(   key = "vamp-example-plugins:amplitudefollower",   wave = audio )  # Access the amplitude output amplitude_data <- result$amplitude head(amplitude_data)  # Run onset detection - may return multiple outputs result <- runPlugin(   key = "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset",   wave = audio )  # See what outputs were produced names(result)  # Access specific outputs onsets <- result$onsets detection_fn <- result$detection_function  # Run plugin with custom parameters # First check what parameters are available params_info <- vampPluginParams("vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset") print(params_info)  # Set specific parameter values result <- runPlugin(   key = "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset",   wave = audio,   params = list(threshold = 0.5, silence = -70) ) } # }
